titles: Staffords Niobe: or His age of teares A treatise no lesse profitable, and comfortable, then the times damnable. Wherein deaths visard is pulled off, and her face discouered not to be so fearefull as the vulgar makes it: and withall it is shewed that death is only bad to the bad, good to the good.
author: Stafford, Anthony.
notes: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Death --  Religious aspects --  Early works to 1800.
